issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: NC should delay VM instance booting until network configuration is available (in all modes)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
Version     : 4.2.0
Release     : 0.0.23996.695.20151007gitbf619d4.el6

I'm seeing ebs backed VMs fail to reach running state, 'timing out via network gate'. Re-opening this ticket for review. Please let me know if this is better tracked in another ticket? NC logs and basic info about the instance below...
Thanks!
-M

NC logs @ 10.111.5.22
{code}
[root@h-22 eucalyptus]# cat nc.log | grep i-ce934f3a
2015-10-08 16:58:15  INFO 000030897 doRunInstance            | [i-ce934f3a] running instance groupId=sg-dd9a7e0e cores=1 disk=5 memory=256 vlan=-1 net=-1 priMAC=d0:0d:37:d8:1a:f0 privIp=172.31.2.248 plat=linux kernel=(null) ramdisk=(null)

fields.summary: VPC - EBS backed instances go to terminate, network timing out on NODE

comments.body:
I'm no longer able to reproduce this issue. Same setup, same image, new code. I'll continue testing this and re-open if it is seen again. 
Thanks,
-M
